intro: Obione oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf obione, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or greenish in color. The botanical interest of Obione oblanceolata lies in its unique leaf morphology and its role in local ecosystems.
